required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Study Will Evaluate the Effect of AZD9164 in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Double-dummy, Placebo-controlled, Randomised, Multi-centre, 5-way Cross-over, Single-dose Study to Investigate the Local and Systemic Effects of Inhaled AZD9164 Compared to Tiotropium in Subjects With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) is a chronic respiratory condition with deteriorating lung function over the years. Patients with COPD experience symptoms of shortness of breath, cough and sputum production. This study is to assess the treatment effects after inhalation of three different single doses of AZD9164 (100, 400 and 1200 mcg) and one single dose of tiotropium (18 mcg). One dose of placebo will be given as comparator. 25 patients are to participate in the study and all will be recruited in Sweden. Each patient will visit the study doctor 9 times during the study, whereof 5 visits will be overnight visits. All examinations, treatment and the follow-up is free of charge.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1), Peak Effect Within 0 - 24 Hours Post-dose
Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1), Average Effect Over 22 - 26 Hours Post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1), Average Effect Over 0 - 24 Hours Post Dose
Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1), Effect at 15 Minutes Post-dose
Systolic Blood Pressure, Average Effect Over 0 - 4 Hours Post-dose
Diastolic Blood Pressure, Average Effect Over 0 - 4 Hours Post-dose
Pulse, Average Effect Over 0 - 4 Hours Post-dose
Heart Rate, Average Effect Over 0 - 4 Hours Post-dose
QTcF, Average Effect Over 0 - 4 Hours Post-dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 60 min, 90 min, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 12 h, 24 h
0, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 60 min, 90 min, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 12 h, 24 h
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the AZD9164 plasma concentration curve

arm_group.arm_group_label: AZD9164 100 mcg First, then Placebo for Spririva
arm_group.description: 1 x AZD9164 solution for inhalation through nebulisation 100 mcg (lung deposited dose) + 1 x placebo for Spiriva dry powder for inhalation

arm_group.arm_group_label: AZD9164 400 mcg First, then Placebo for Spiriva
arm_group.description: 1 x AZD9164 solution for inhalation through nebulisation 400 mcg (lung deposited dose) + 1 x placebo for Spiriva dry powder for inhalation

arm_group.arm_group_label: AZD9164 1200 mcg First, then Placebo for Spiriva
arm_group.description: 1 x AZD9164 solution for inhalation through nebulisation 1200 mcg (lung deposited dose) + 1 x placebo for Spiriva dry powder for inhalation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Spiriva 18 mcg First, then Placebo for AZD9164
arm_group.description: 1 x Spiriva dry powder for inhalation 18 mcg + 1 x placebo for AZD9164 (sodium chloride)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Placebo for Spiriva First, then Placebo for AZD9164
arm_group.description: 1 x placebo Spiriva dry powder for inhalation + 1 x placebo for AZD9164 (sodium chloride)

AZD9164 400 mcg First, then Placebo for Spiriva

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A clinical diagnosis of COPD
- FEV1 40 - 80% of the predicted normal value (post-bronchodilator) and post- bronchodilator FEV1/FVC < 70%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any clinically relevant abnormal findings at screening examinations
- Any clinically significant disease or disorder

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study has been performed at four centers in Sweden. The first subject entered the study on 23 June 2009 and the last subject completed the study on 6 November 2009.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: An Investigator agrees to provide a copy of the publication to AZ for review at least 60 days in advance of submission for publication. Investigators in multicenter (MC) studies agree to postpone MC publications until the earlier of the date of the first AZ-authorized MC publication or a period up to 18 months from study completion at all sites. AZ has the right to request delays: up to 60 days for confidential information, and an additional 90 days to protect intellectual property.
